intro: Agaloma corollata var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved agaloma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
